title: Liternum
description: An ancient city of Campania located near the mouth of the Volturnus river; a Roman colony was established at Liternum in 194 B.C. The site is most famous as the location of the villa of Scipio Africanus, as described by Seneca.

properties.description: 1:500,000 scale representative point location digitized from the Barrington Atlas of the Greek and Roman World by the Digital Atlas of Roman and Medieval Civilizations project at Harvard University.
properties.title: DARMC location 18519

properties.description: Representative location of the archaeological site based on a way derived from OpenStreetMap that traces the visible boundaries of same.
properties.title: OSM location of  Liternum, Lago Patria
